resources.string: Your device is ARM32 but uses a 64-bit binder. This usually indicates that the hardware supports 64-bit but the software does not. In this scenario you should use an image named \"binder64\" or \"a64\"
Your device supports System-as-Root. Use an A/B operating system.
Your device does not support System-as-Root. Use an A-only Operating System.

Please don\'t leave a bad review if I left a bug; I wrote the whole app in a week! Instead contact me via Telegram using the button in the top right. Tell me about your issue and I will endeavour to help.
Your device does not support Project Treble
Your device supports the legacy version of Project Treble, using VNDK %3$sversion %1$d.%2$d
Your device supports the modern version of Project Treble, using VNDK %3$sversion %1$d.%2$d
